name: Murderous Redcap Avatar
text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control with a counter on it, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: SHM Participation Avatar

name: Murderous Spoils
text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated. You gain control of all Equipment that was attached to it. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

editions.flavor: Scavengers are always the first to pay their respects.

name: Murk Dwellers
text: Whenever Murk Dwellers attacks and isn't blocked, it gets +2/+0 until end of combat.

editions.flavor: When Raganorn unsealed the catacombs, he found more than the dead and their treasures.
When Raganorn unsealed the catacombs, he found more than the dead and their treasures.

name: Murkfiend Liege
text:
Other green creatures you control get +1/+1.
Other blue creatures you control get +1/+1.
Untap all green and/or blue creatures you control during each other player's untap step.

name: Murk Strider
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
When Murk Strider enters the battlefield, you may put a card an opponent owns from exile into that player's graveyard. If you do, return target creature to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: If you can see it, it's too late.

name: Murmuring Bosk
text:
({T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.)
As Murmuring Bosk enters the battlefield, you may reveal a Treefolk card from your hand. If you don't, Murmuring Bosk enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} or {B} to your mana pool. Murmuring Bosk deals 1 damage to you.

name: Murmuring Phantasm
text: Defender

editions.flavor:
"The most insidious thing in the world is nonsense that sounds just plausible enough to listen to."
—Lazav

name: Murmurs from Beyond
text: Reveal the top three cards of your library. An opponent chooses one of them. Put that card into your graveyard and the rest into your hand.

editions.flavor: Like pools of fog that hid treacherous rocks from sailors' eyes, so too were the hands of the kami.
Like pools of fog that hid treacherous rocks from sailors' eyes, so too were the hands of the kami.

name: Muscle Burst
text: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is 3 plus the number of cards named Muscle Burst in all graveyards.

editions.flavor: As strong as a centaur's will.

name: Muscle Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures get +1/+1.

editions.flavor: The air was filled with the cracks and snaps of flesh hardening as the new sliver joined the battle.
The air was filled with the cracks and snaps of flesh hardening as the new sliver joined the battle.
The air was filled with the cracks and snaps of flesh hardening as the new sliver joined the battle.

name: Muse Vessel
text:
{3}, {T}: Target player exiles a card from his or her hand. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
{1}: Choose a card exiled with Muse Vessel. You may play that card this turn.

name: Musician
text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
{T}: Put a music counter on target creature. If it doesn't have "At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy this creature unless you pay {1} for each music counter on it," it gains that ability.

name: Mutagenic Growth
text:
({G/P} can be paid with either {G} or 2 life.)
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Sympathy is for weaklings. Whoever survives, wins."
—Benzir, archdruid of Temple Might

"Sympathy is for weaklings. Whoever survives, wins."
—Benzir, archdruid of Temple Might

name: Mutant's Prey
text: Target creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it fights target creature an opponent controls. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

editions.flavor: Every street corner is a hunting ground, every citizen potential prey.

name: Mutavault
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{1}: Mutavault becomes a 2/2 creature with all creature types until end of turn. It's still a land.

editions.flavor: Some worlds possess a hidden core where life's essence constantly surges.
Some changelings born at Velis Vel never return, but their essence never leaves.

name: Mutilate
text: All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn for each Swamp you control.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Garruk vs. Liliana
editions.flavor: Liliana developed a fondness for the moment when roaring becomes squealing.

"They appreciate my handiwork. I hear their joy in every scream."
—Chainer, dementia master
Liliana developed a fondness for the moment when roaring becomes squealing.

"It's only torture if you're strong enough to survive. Otherwise, it's a simple, gruesome death. I'm happy with either outcome."
—Liliana Vess

"It's only torture if you're strong enough to survive. Otherwise, it's a simple, gruesome death. I'm happy either way."
—Liliana Vess

name: Mutual Epiphany
text: When you encounter Mutual Epiphany, each player draws four cards. (Then planeswalk away from this phenomenon.)

name: Muzzio's Preparations
text:
Hidden agenda (Start the game with this conspiracy face down in the command zone and secretly name a card. You may turn this conspiracy face up any time and reveal the chosen name.)
Each creature you control with the chosen name enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.

name: Muzzio, Visionary Architect
text: {3}{U}, {T}: Look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the highest converted mana cost among artifacts you control. You may reveal an artifact card from among them and put it onto the battlefield. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

name: Muzzle
text:
Enchant creature
Prevent all damage that would be dealt by enchanted creature.

editions.flavor:
Clenched teeth do not bite.
—Cho-Arrim saying

name: Mwonvuli Acid-Moss
text: Destroy target land. Search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor:
"Life gives way to death, and death to new life. Nature feeds upon her own decay."
—Ezrith, druid of the Dark Hours

name: Mwonvuli Beast Tracker
text: When Mwonvuli Beast Tracker enters the battlefield, search your library for a creature card with deathtouch, hexproof, reach, or trample and reveal it. Shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.

editions.flavor: "The more dangerous, the better."

name: Mwonvuli Ooze
text:
Cumulative upkeep {2} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay {2} for each age counter on it.)
Mwonvuli Ooze's power and toughness are each equal to 1 plus twice the number of age counters on it.

editions.flavor: "Ewww!"

name: Mycoid Shepherd
text: Whenever Mycoid Shepherd or another creature you control with power 5 or greater dies, you may gain 5 life.

editions.flavor: As pure mana flooded across the shards, it brought a sense of unity even to Jund's vicious food chain.

name: Mycologist
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Mycologist.
Remove three spore counters from Mycologist: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
Sacrifice a Saproling: You gain 2 life.

name: Mycoloth
text:
Devour 2 (As this enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature enters the battlefield with twice that many +1/+1 counters on it.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token for each +1/+1 counter on Mycoloth.

name: Mycosynth Fiend
text: Mycosynth Fiend gets +1/+1 for each poison counter your opponents have.

editions.flavor:
"I wish I could take credit for it, but nature progresses on its own, just the way it should."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

name: Mycosynth Golem
text:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
Artifact creature spells you cast have affinity for artifacts. (They cost {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)

name: Mycosynth Lattice
text:
All permanents are artifacts in addition to their other types.
All cards that aren't on the battlefield, spells, and permanents are colorless.
Players may spend mana as though it were mana of any color.

name: Mycosynth Wellspring
text: When Mycosynth Wellspring enters the battlefield or is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: The oil created the mycosynth. The mycosynth created New Phyrexia.
The oil created the mycosynth. The mycosynth created New Phyrexia.
The oil created the mycosynth. The mycosynth created New Phyrexia.

name: My Crushing Masterstroke
text: When you set this scheme in motion, gain control of all nonland permanents your opponents control until end of turn. Untap those permanents. They gain haste until end of turn. Each of them attacks its owner this turn if able.

name: My First Tome
text: {1}, {T}: Say the flavor text on a card in your hand. Target opponent guesses that card's name. You may reveal that card. If you do and your opponent guessed wrong, draw a card.

editions.flavor: This card is named My First Tome.

name: My Genius Knows No Bounds
text: When you set this scheme in motion, you may pay {X}. If you do, you gain X life and draw X cards.

editions.flavor: "I can see . . . everything. The beginning and the end of time. The raw edges of reality. And now I see exactly how to kill you."

name: Myojin of Cleansing Fire
text:
Myojin of Cleansing Fire enters the battlefield with a divinity counter on it if you cast it from your hand.
Myojin of Cleansing Fire has indestructible as long as it has a divinity counter on it.
Remove a divinity counter from Myojin of Cleansing Fire: Destroy all other creatures.

name: Myojin of Infinite Rage
text:
Myojin of Infinite Rage enters the battlefield with a divinity counter on it if you cast it from your hand.
Myojin of Infinite Rage has indestructible as long as it has a divinity counter on it.
Remove a divinity counter from Myojin of Infinite Rage: Destroy all lands.

name: Myojin of Life's Web
text:
Myojin of Life's Web enters the battlefield with a divinity counter on it if you cast it from your hand.
Myojin of Life's Web has indestructible as long as it has a divinity counter on it.
Remove a divinity counter from Myojin of Life's Web: Put any number of creature cards from your hand onto the battlefield.

name: Myojin of Night's Reach
text:
Myojin of Night's Reach enters the battlefield with a divinity counter on it if you cast it from your hand.
Myojin of Night's Reach has indestructible as long as it has a divinity counter on it.
Remove a divinity counter from Myojin of Night's Reach: Each opponent discards his or her hand.

name: Myojin of Seeing Winds
text:
Myojin of Seeing Winds enters the battlefield with a divinity counter on it if you cast it from your hand.
Myojin of Seeing Winds has indestructible as long as it has a divinity counter on it.
Remove a divinity counter from Myojin of Seeing Winds: Draw a card for each permanent you control.

name: Myr Adapter
text: Myr Adapter gets +1/+1 for each Equipment attached to it.

editions.flavor:
"The simplest way to plan ahead is merely to be ready for everything."
—Pontifex, elder researcher

name: Myr Battlesphere
text:
When Myr Battlesphere enters the battlefield, create four 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature tokens.
Whenever Myr Battlesphere attacks, you may tap X untapped Myr you control. If you do, Myr Battlesphere gets +X/+0 until end of turn and deals X damage to defending player.

text: Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)

text:
Other Myr creatures you control get +1/+1.
{1}, {T}: Untap each other Myr you control.

editions.flavor:
"We can't quite determine what they're doing, but they seem to be doing it quite well."
—Vedalken research notes

name: Myriad Landscape
text:
Myriad Landscape enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{2}, {T}, Sacrifice Myriad Landscape: Search your library for up to two basic land cards that share a land type, put them onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

name: Myr Incubator
text: {6}, {T}, Sacrifice Myr Incubator: Search your library for any number of artifact cards, exile them, then create that many 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature tokens. Then shuffle your library.

name: Myr Landshaper
text: {T}: Target land becomes an artifact in addition to its other types until end of turn.

editions.flavor: One thing the myr can't do is enjoy the scenery.

name: Myr Matrix
text:
Indestructible (Effects that say "destroy" don't destroy this artifact.)
Myr creatures get +1/+1.
{5}: Create a 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature token.

name: Myr Mindservant
text: {2}, {T}: Shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: It knows what you are planning, and does not approve.

name: Myr Moonvessel
text: When Myr Moonvessel dies, add {C} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Memnarch created the myr with three qualities in mind: dependability, controllability, and disposability.

name: Myr Propagator
text: {3}, {T}: Create a token that's a copy of Myr Propagator.

editions.flavor:
"We will ingest and remake this world in our image, not unlike some admirable designs I have seen here."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

name: Myr Prototype
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Myr Prototype.
Myr Prototype can't attack or block unless you pay {1} for each +1/+1 counter on it.

name: Myr Quadropod
text: {3}: Switch Myr Quadropod's power and toughness until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Each myr was designed to fill a specific role. This one, for example, was designed to stomp on other myr.

name: Myr Reservoir
text:
{T}: Add {C}{C} to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast Myr spells or activate abilities of Myr.
{3}, {T}: Return target Myr card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: A mana well as bottomless as the myr are tireless.

name: Myr Retriever
text: When Myr Retriever dies, return another target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: Mephidross gives up treasure easily . . . as long as you take its place.
Mephidross gives up treasure easily . . . as long as you take its place.
Mephidross gives up treasure easily . . . as long as you take its place.

name: Myr Servitor
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if Myr Servitor is on the battlefield, each player returns all cards named Myr Servitor from his or her graveyard to the battlefield.

editions.flavor: The Krark Clan enjoys pulling them apart just to watch them reassemble one another.

name: Myr Sire
text: When Myr Sire dies, create a 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature token.

editions.flavor: For the Phyrexians, death is not an end, nor a one-time occurrence.
For the Phyrexians, death is not an end, nor a one-time occurrence.

name: Myrsmith
text: Whenever you cast an artifact spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, create a 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature token.

editions.flavor: The Auriok see the artificer as a conduit, beckoning new creations into the world.
The Auriok see the artificer as a conduit, beckoning new creations into the world.

name: Myr Superion
text: Spend only mana produced by creatures to cast Myr Superion.

editions.flavor: Two kinds of myr survive: the powerful and those that stay close by them.

name: Myr Turbine
text:
{T}: Create a 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature token.
{T}, Tap five untapped Myr you control: Search your library for a Myr creature card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

name: Myr Welder
text:
Imprint — {T}: Exile target artifact card from a graveyard.
Myr Welder has all activated abilities of all cards exiled with it.

editions.flavor: Memnarch designed some myr to follow the levelers and reaffix lost parts. Mirran partisans put that instinct to good use.

name: Mysteries of the Deep
text:
Draw two cards.
Landfall — If you had a land enter the battlefield under your control this turn, draw three cards instead.

editions.flavor:
"The Roil is destructive, but not random. It's Zendikar's way of revealing secrets."
—Ilori, merfolk falconer

name: Mystical Teachings
text:
Search your library for an instant card or a card with flash, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
Flashback {5}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Mystical Tutor
text: Search your library for an instant or sorcery card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.

editions.flavor:
"To the tutors, a ‘poem of sand' was of little account, a ‘poem of ivory,' priceless."
—Afari, Tales
The student searches the world for meaning. The master finds worlds of meaning in the search.

name: Mystic Barrier
text:
When Mystic Barrier enters the battlefield or at the beginning of your upkeep, choose left or right.
Each player may attack only the opponent seated nearest him or her in the last chosen direction and planeswalkers controlled by that player.

name: Mystic Compass
text: {1}, {T}: Target land becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"And I say north is where I want it to be!"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Mystic Confluence
text:
Choose three. You may choose the same mode more than once.
• Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.
• Return target creature to its owner's hand.
• Draw a card.

name: Mystic Crusader
text:
Protection from black and from red
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Mystic Crusader gets +1/+1 and has flying.

name: Mystic Decree
text: All creatures lose flying and islandwalk.

—Irini Sengir

name: Mystic Denial
text: Counter target creature or sorcery spell.

text:
Protection from black
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Mystic Enforcer gets +3/+3 and has flying.

name: Mystic Familiar
text:
Flying
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Mystic Familiar gets +1/+1 and has protection from black.

editions.flavor: They soar, and the mystics follow.

name: Mystic Gate
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{W/U}, {T}: Add {W}{W}, {W}{U}, or {U}{U} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: The gate of every kithkin doun is a cunning trap, intended to spill visitors into an oubliette from which there is no escape.

name: Mystic Genesis
text: Counter target spell. Create an X/X green Ooze creature token, where X is that spell's converted mana cost.

editions.flavor:
"The Simic can grow anything out of a puddle of sludge. I just hope they never join forces with the Golgari."

—Teysa Karlov, Grand Envoy of Orzhov

name: Mystic Meditation
text: Draw three cards. Then discard two cards unless you discard a creature card.

editions.flavor:
"Still the mind and quiet the heart. Only then will you hear the Multiverse's great truths."
—Narset

name: Mystic Melting
text:
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

editions.flavor: The sun-hot glow radiated from the druids, leaving scattered metal in steaming pools as it passed.

name: Mystic Might
text:
Enchant land you control
Cumulative upkeep {1}{U} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

name: Mystic Monastery
text:
Mystic Monastery enters the battlefield tapped.

name: Mystic Veil
text:

"Magic is my thread, my will the needle. I weave over you as if you never were."
—Poetics of Hanan

name: Mystic Visionary
text: Threshold — Mystic Visionary has flying as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

editions.flavor: "The aven are heralds of divinity. The greatest glory is to join them in the sky."

name: Mystic Zealot
text: Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Mystic Zealot gets +1/+1 and has flying.

text:

Enchant creature

text:
(An ongoing scheme remains face up until it's abandoned.)

text: When you set this scheme in motion, each opponent reveals his or her hand. You may choose a noncreature, nonland card revealed this way and cast it without paying its mana cost.

editions.flavor: "Indulge me. Just one spell. One potentially fatal spell gone horribly awry."
